I no longer have any income. What must I.title: I no longer have any income. What must I do?
plaintext: On March 25, the federal government announced the Canada Emergency Response Benefit (CERB), which provides $2 000 per month for workers who are the victims of the COVID-19 pandemic.
All Canadians who are unable to work because of COVID-19 are entitled to the benefit whether or not they are eligible for employment insurance, in particular those who have lost income because:

of COVID-19, including those who still have a job but are no longer receiving income because of COVID-19-related work interruptions;they are sick or in quarantine;   they must stay home to take care of a child or someone suffering from the virus.
To apply for the CERB, you must register on the federal government website.
I no longer have any income. What must I.html:
On March 25, the federal government announced the Canada Emergency Response Benefit (CERB), which provides $2 000 per month for workers who are the victims of the COVID-19 pandemic.

All Canadians who are unable to work because of COVID-19 are entitled to the benefit whether or not they are eligible for employment insurance, in particular those who have lost income because:

  • of COVID-19, including those who still have a job but are no longer receiving income because of COVID-19-related work interruptions;
  • they are sick or in quarantine;
  • they must stay home to take care of a child or someone suffering from the virus.

To apply for the CERB, you must register on the federal government website.

Why is the Temporary Aid for Workers Pro.title: Why is the Temporary Aid for Workers Program (PATT) ending?
plaintext: The PATT was going to end when other financial assistance programs covering the same needs were introduced. The Canada Emergency Response Benefit (CERB) offered by the federal government meets peoples’ needs, which is why the PATT is no longer necessary.

What impacts do the health and safety di.title: What impacts do the health and safety directives in relation to COVID-19 have on the operations and services of the Ministère du Tourisme?
plaintext: The operations of the Ministère du Tourisme are continuing to provide good support to the industry.
In accordance with the public health directives, most personnel are providing their services by telework.
To facilitate processing of files, tourism businesses are invited to send all documents by email, including the financial assistance agreements during signing.

Due to the current health crisis, the call centres and Infotouriste Centres are closed until further notice.  Government corporations under the responsibility of the Ministère du Tourisme, specifically the Régie des installations olympiques, the Palais des congrès de Montréal and Centre des congrès de Québec, have also ceased their activities welcoming the public.

I must send documents to an employee of.title: I must send documents to an employee of the Ministère du Tourisme. What is the best way to proceed?
plaintext: Although the mail continues to be processed, it is possible that the current situation will result in some delays. It is therefore recommended to send all documents by email to speed up processing of files.
In case your application requires an official signature, you may scan your document and send it to an advisor  (French only) by email, and then mail the original, which will be attached to your file.
